metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1270 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The ucnv_io_getConverterName function in common/ucnv_io.cpp inInternational Components for Unicode (ICU), as used in Google Chrome before44.0.2403.89, mishandles converter names with initial x- substrings, whichallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (read of uninitializedmemory) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1270` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095
chromium-browser-l10n - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095
chromium-chromedriver - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libicu52 - 52.1-3ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
icu package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.1-3ubuntu0.4').
